name: PortAventura Hotel Caribe

reviews.text: Just returned from a week in the Caribe and have to say this hotel is not the best 4 star hotel in the world. Check in staff speak only limited English.Staff in general pleasant but some are quite rude .Rooms are clean and are certainly big enough for 4.now for the downside . the buffet restaurant has a good choice of food ,but we never had a hot meal there all week. the hot plates were just not up to the task. When we tried to have a meal in the other restaurant we were abruptly told that as we were on half board basis it was not possible and we must eat in Buffy restaurant even though we were prepared to pay .When we asked at reception why we could not eat in the restaurant we could not get a answer. Alcoholic drinks are not to badly priced 2.60 for bottle of Bud but 2.80 euros for soft drinks are a bit Ch'in the hotel all menus and information are in Spanish.The grounds are very impressive and well kept. Portavetura park is excellent value for money.Shuttle service to park is excellent but return ride is difficult as Spanish use it as a free ride down the hill. also Spanish people don't do ques
reviews.title: nice time shame about the food

reviews.text: stayed here with a friend for a long weekend (got back this morning) and we had a great time. the complete theme and ambience of the hotel was excellent, the big water feature, the two simming pools at either end (and the third pool just for suite guests), the food was excellent as was the service. even simple things like giant chess, volleyball pitches, pro jogging track around the perimeter of the hotel., etc etc. we had the hotel booked from 14th (3pm check-in) to 16th (11am check-out) and park entrance was included for three full days- we turned up at the hotel at 10am on the 14th and they gave us our theme park passes (which double as hotel room entry keys), took care of our bags and we disappeared to the park for a few hours until our room was ready, got back at 3pm, changed and straight out the door into the white sandy beached pool area. will definitely be back next year!
reviews.title: Almost perfect...

likes.disliked: — the bar was out of some drinks

reviews.text: Just returned from this holiday and never again. The room wasn't ready, safe was broken along with air conditioning, and the towel rail fell off whilst in the shower, the wardrobe door was hanging on by 1 screw, and later on we discovered rubbish on the shelves dating back to Aug 06!! From checking in at 2.30pm it took until 10.20pm to get most of the items fixed. Phone cards that were purchsed from the rep didn't work in the hotels phones, and the floor in our room was only washed once during the week. The meals were absolutely terrible. Very bland and COLD. We ate most nights at the El Paso which had a much better choice and also the food was slightly warmer - one night we actually got hot food. The theme park and water park were excellent value and really enjoyed them, food wasn't too bad priced in the theme park. For this hotel to be a 4 star I very much doubt. Won't be going back there again!!
reviews.title: AARRGH - never again

reviews.text: Just got back from the Caribe and had a fantastic time. The hotel is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in you could of eaten your buffet dinner off the floor. The hotel has the most amazing grounds that make you feel so relaxed after a hard day at the theme park. The beach pool is such a simple idea but the best pool i have ever swam in made you really feel that you were at the beach and life guards and duty every second of the day while the sun is out. The food was good and if you did find it alittle luke warm then pop it in the microwaves that are dotted around the dining room (simple) The theme park was very family based which was excellent as this holiday was a surprise for our 10 year old daughter she loved every minute and we never really needed to queue for any rides which was brill the park was also really clean no litter at all. The water park was also excellent and lots of fun, but one of the highlights was the beach club resort which was out of this world with the most amazing swimming pools and also no need to take towels as these are given to you at no cost as you enter. if there were any down falls with this hotel it would have to be that the bar staff we not very friendly but all the other staff were fine. We had a great holiday and will return in a few years time.
reviews.title: "fantastic"
Ideal for the theme park
reviews.text: Stayed for a week at the Caribe Resort in August this year with 4 kids ( 2 x 15, 1 x 12 and 1 x 8) so we we had two rooms. Booked direct but possibly better deals to be had as part of a package to be honest. Rooms good quality and hotel in general is good quality. Ideal location for theme and water park with free bus service and also tried beach club which was good too. Food good quality and pool/failities pretty decent.

Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Hotel Caribe Resort. We had a wonderful holiday, the hotel and facilities were brilliant. The rooms were nice but slightly tatty with age, the bed wasn't very comfortable and the walls are paper thin so you can hear everything going on in the next room. Food was o.k but buffet restaurant served same thing all the time and it got a bit boring after a while, we never had to queue for the buffet apart from at the weekend. However you can swap your meal sitting at guest services and have dinner in any of the a la carte restaurants within the Portaventura Park and Hotels as many times as you want. The hotel and park are very busy at the weekend with locals. I would suggest booking a trip away from the resort as the majority of the locals are ignorant to say the least and have no concept of queuing what so ever. Personally we found the best time to visit the park was around 4pm onwards during the week as it was simply too busy at other times. The hotel provide you with express passes for some of the main attractions which came in handy. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful and I personally thought the drinks and snacks in the resort were reasonably priced. You can get a taxi into Salou from the hotel for around 5 euros but it is really only a 10 minute walk. We didn't think much of the beach club, the pools are nice but the location is not so nice, very dusty and windy which made it impossible to sit on the beach as we were practically in the middle of a sandstorm!!!! I would recommed the main beach in Salou which was very clean and really nice, even though Salou is very tacky. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and the kids loved every minute of it. The hotel grounds are well maintained and clean and we were generally very pleased with the resort.
reviews.title: Great for kids!!!!!

reviews.text: Got back from the resort yesterday and could not fault the Hotel. I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and this does not make it into the 5 star category but does sit comfortably in the 4 star rating.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Caribe Portaventura

reviews.text: It is with no doubt a family resort if you want a quiet holiday just for 2 without any children this wouldn't be the place to go unless of course you love the theme parks.
reviews.title: Oh My God!!!! Most Hateful Place, Hateful Staff

reviews.text: The buffet was great , always a different choice of certain foods each night but obviously they can't change everything. If you get fed up with the buffet you can always go to the other restaurants with an allowance of, if I remember around 50 euros and then pay the difference if you spend anything above that.
reviews.title: Prefer the El Paso

reviews.text: All the staff were helpful and guest services we always there to help. The 2 swimming pools were lovely not at all cold like some have mentioned.
reviews.title: We enjoyed it

likes.liked: — Club San Juan was overall more comfortable than standard accommodation.
likes.disliked: — Thin walls, hard beds, uncomfortable pillows in standard rooms.

reviews.text: Just back from 6 nights at the Caribe Resort. I read some negative reviews before we went and they put me off a bit. Honestly, the place is fine! There are some minor niggles but nothing bad. Room was spotlessly clean and the maid came every day. It was a bit cramped for 2 adults & 2 kids but we didn't go there to spend much time in a room. There is no kettle in the room but there is a fridge,,, take a travel kettle. Room was noisy, from above,,, people dragging chairs and stomping about. It didn't bother me but I can imagine that it would upset others? If you're fussed, ask for a top floor room and if you're on the top floor, please be considerate! The aircon does't work if the patio door is open or when the room key is not in it's slot. Room keys are used for access to park etc, so when you go out, the room gets hot. Top tip,,, fold a bit of cardboard and shove it in the slot - works just as well ;) We were next to the train track but trains are very few and far between and didn't bother us at all.
reviews.title: No big complaints

reviews.text: The meals were fine, great choice including theme nights. We have a very fussy vegitarean in the family and she ate well. Some things are piping hot, some are warm. It's not because the hot plates aren't working, it's because that's how the Spanish enjoy those particular foods. If you must have everything hot, there are microwaves. Kids fizzy drinks were expensive, a rip off at 2.50E for a coke! Beer and other drinks were normal priced.
reviews.title: Loved Port Aventura but hotel only average

reviews.text: The pools were lovely. Uncrowded, lots of sun beds, very clean and warm enough once you got in. The lifeguards are very strict and this was perfect for the 95% of us who don't want to swim with boisterous teenagers.
reviews.title: We were treated like cattle

reviews.text: If you want a trip to Barcelona, I suggest you take the train which goes from Port Aventura station approx every 90 minutes. It was very cheap, 2 adults & 2 kids for about 40E return.
reviews.title: excellent - would stay again

reviews.text: We never visited the park until after 8.00 each evening and never queed for more than a couple of minutes. We didn't need the fast passes! Costa Caribe water park wasn't very impressive. Not enough slides, 4E per sunbed, 7E for an inflatable - Aquapolis is better.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday!
not bad but far from good
reviews.text: just came back and found the hotel to be very clean and tidy,

pools were very cold through most of the day. bars can be expensive with nowhere on site to buy supplies for the rooms so went into town and bought cans of beer, crisps,coke, coffee and a kettle because the rooms dont have one but the do have a fridge.
reviews.title: best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our tv picked up bbc1,2,4 and cebebies.
reviews.title: Butlins in the Sun!!!!

reviews.text: most (but not all) of the staff are great, the reception and porters were very good. the catering staff were less than useless and in some cases down right rude.
reviews.title: San Juan no way 5 star at Caribe

likes.liked: — location near park although train still a problem

reviews.text: if you are english and try to take a pushchair into the dining room and you will be told that its not allowed, then just check out how many spanish families take them in.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

likes.liked: — part of the port adventura park and the value for money
likes.disliked: — No heated outdoor pool at hotel

description: Come to an oasis of peace where you do not have to lift a finger for yourself, providing you with the opportunity to recover some of the adrenaline expended in PortAventura Park. Enjoy the serenity, white sands and freshwater of one of Europe’s largest man-made beaches, surrounded by palms and exotic gardens that will transport you to a faraway tropical island.Become acquainted with this magnificent 4-star resort, a perfect combination of fun, sun, beach and tranquillity at the heart of the Costa Dorada. Complete the experience with an ample choice of gastronomic delights, unlimited access to the PortAventura theme park with admission included throughout your stay, and an extensive programme of sporting activities with special offers and rates available at associated golf courses. Visit the Wellness Centre & Spa, where you will be looked after and spoiled, making your holiday the ideal opportunity to restore energy and vitality. So what are you waiting for? Grab your sun lounger and dedicate your holidays to peaceful relaxation and enjoyment. Let yourself drift away and take it easy, with direct access to one of the best theme parks in Europe.
